content:
North America Telugu Society was formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers of similar values to serve Telugu communities across North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities. Today, NATS is one of the largest non-profit national organizations for Telugu people living in North America
So far volunteers solicited, collected, and disbursed funds for charitable purposes to meet the goals of the organization; and to preserve, propagate and perpetuate Telugu cultural heritage in North America. Our flagship has been a 24x7 helpline 1-888-483-5848 to provide immediate assistance for anyone needing help
Bi-annually NATS conducts a 3-day convention where approximately 8000 people attend to celebrate Telugu culture. This year we are planning to celebrate our 7th annual convention at Raritan Convention Center from May 26-28. This three-day mega event includes various cultural, literary, and business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing Education classes, Women's forums, and career development for the younger generation.
Every year we invite a few dignitaries (e.g. Vice President of India Mr. Venkaiah Naidu, Apple Ex-CEO John Scully, Kapil Dev, Dean of Wharton Business School, etc.) state governors for the main event. We are planning to do the same.
